intro: Stelis capijumensis, commonly known as the Capijuegos orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow, typically blooming during the warmer months. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to absorb moisture from the surrounding soil. Stelis capijumensis is often found in shaded, humid environments such as forests and rocky slopes.
